title: Sourcing Manager
description:
Responsibilities

Lead negotiations and supplier selection Continuously looks for new savings opportunities through analysis of data (spend, purchase price variance, etc.) and hands on review of materials in the production areas. Leads Request for Proposal (RFP) process with all stakeholders. Works with suppliers and internal team members to qualify new parts. Negotiates key items with suppliers including pricing, payment terms, lead time, and inventory programs. Records and tracks information as required for timely and accurate measure of performance regarding sourcing activities and savings. Support the plants to help local teams efficiently resolve escalated issues. Leads Procurement NPD activities through preferred supplier programs and RFQ's. Identify gaps to goals and collaboratively develop and support countermeasures and activities to close the gap and exceed targets. Work to align strategies between commodity and sector localization, plant rationalization and similar Works with suppliers to address significant and/or systemic issues with performance (quality, delivery, warranty, etc.) as may be required in support of plant Manufacturing, Purchasing and Quality teams Responsible for coordinating with commodity teams, materials, operations, engineering, finance, quality, and field operations to complete projects and achieve expected benefits within project timeline. Creates continuous improvement ideation sessions for responsible plants. Generate and evaluate new ideas and opportunities aligned with plant priorities and strategies. Participate in and represent Sourcing function during plant or product Value Analysis/Value Engineering (VAVE) or Major Model Review (MMR) events. Responsible for collecting and communicating commodity actions following event. Performs additional duties as assigned and participates in special projects as required. 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain, Engineering or equivalent 5+ years of progressive job-related experience Prior experience in a sourcing or supply chain role preferred Incumbent must have well-developed negotiation skills and assessing vendors. Experience using Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Word, is required. Proficiency using Excel at an advanced level (use financial and logical functions; work with multiple worksheets and workbooks; edit and use macros/ import and export information) is strongly preferred. Previous lean manufacturing or 6 Sigma Green Belt/Black Belt experience a plus Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data, confirming its accuracy and adequacy, and using it to drive decisions as well as present results and business cases to management Oracle & SAP experience in a global environment is preferred Ability to travel up to 10% 

The successful candidate will:

Be a self-starter and highly motivated Incumbent must have strong written and verbal communication skills, demonstrated effective leadership and influencing skills and practices Experience coordinating, facilitating discussions, consultation and conflict resolution skills Ability and willingness to understand and interact with diverse groups and cultures Evidence of skills & attributes including effective listening, gathering complete information, ensuring accuracy, problem-solving, negotiating, researching discrepancies, and handling conflict are critical. The ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, meet compressed deadlines, and handle frequent interruptions is essential. Strong bias for action and results orientation Ability and willingness to respond quickly and appropriately in a dynamic, fast paced work environment and the flexibility to withstand challenging situations 

Key Competencies

Complex Decision-Making Impeccable time-management Supply Chain Acumen Project Management Relationship Management

title: Inside Sales Specialist
description:
Title: Inside Sales Specialist

Location: Remote

About Us

Elevate your career as our Inside Sales Specialist in this Remote (USA) opportunity. We're seeking a dynamic go-getter to join forces with our field sales team. A polished professional who’s already owned their book of business and is interested in being a driving force in the heart of our Pumps (IRP) and MP/Oberdorfer (MPOB) business units.

Job Summary

If you're a proactive individual with a passion for protecting and nurturing client relationships, this is your moment! Unleash your skills to conquer sales objectives within your designated districts or product range. Dive into engaging conversations with customers, be the liaison with internal peers, and take the initiative to elevate our business partnerships! As you climb the ladder of success, you'll not only have the chance to guide new sales representatives but also unlock the exciting potential to step into an outside sales career within our dynamic team.

Responsibilities

Sales Support: Addresses customer/distributor calls for product purchases, account problem resolution, and logistics. Collaborates with Sales Manager to resolve issues. Sales Calls-Presentations: Virtually meets with existing/potential customers, presenting product info, quotations, and proposals throughout the sales process. Technical Sales: Applies technical knowledge to recommend solutions meeting customer needs. Provides technical support to existing customers. Pricing: Consults Manager on setting prices and discounts, updating on competitive pricing and margins. Written Communication: Maintains CRM for tracking inquiries, quotes, bids, and customer contacts. Proposal Development: Creates formal quotes, coordinates with internal departments for inquiry responses and proposals. Sales Goals: Develops business plans, provides territory feedback, qualifies leads, and conducts MBRs and QBRs. Other responsibilities as assigned or required.

This is a remote role, with up to 25% travel as needed.

Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of experience or equivalent years of experience in inside sales supporting a manufacturing company. Union manufacturing experience is preferred. Demonstrated experience in direct customer communications and customer service. Demonstrated experience in stakeholder management, effectively managing multiple accounts and customers required, consistent follow-up is a key component for the successful candidate. Excellent communication skills are necessary.

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Warehouse Manager

Connersville, IN - On-site 

At Ingersoll Rand, our goal is to build a dedicated team of star individuals who will function with the agility and "all hands on deck" attitude of a start-up, while being supported by the resources and stability of a global business. We are looking for people who are excited to pitch in on diverse projects and who thrives in a fast-paced, results-oriented team culture.

The Warehouse Manager’s primary responsibility is to monitor and maintain inventory integrity, preservation, and presentation to all supporting departments. Supervise the hourly workforce, assigning daily duties, control inventory transactions and movement throughout the facility.

Responsibilities 

Ensure accurate product inventory Develop and implement inventory control procedures and best practices Conduct cycle count inventory processes to ensure accuracy and timely execution Oversee & evaluate stock rotation processesTrain staff in product dating & create procedures to eliminate loss Maintain adequate storage for warehouse & on-site inventoryCreate space utilization plan Notify planning/purchasing of shortages or other problems that could impact product availability Instruct staff on proper procedures for locating and utilizing product inventory Check orders/picks for accuracy prior to shipment Ensure all material issued to PSO/picklistsMonitor open picklists Supervise warehouse employees including material handlers & oversee daily operations Enforce all company rules & regulations Ensure a high degree of detail & focus on every job Communicate with drivers to ensure efficient delivery of product to the floor Attend DM board, report as required Reconcile ERP with physical counts Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed 
Qualifications

ERP experience, SAP or Oracle preferred Innovator of change and extreme desire for continuous improvement Strong computer skills with a high proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Commitment to providing excellent customer service to both internal and external customers. Comfortable in a leadership role and able to lead discussions with employees from multiple departments. Capable of analyzing and utilizing data to make decisions Must have strong desire and drive for continuous learning. Ability to multitask and prioritize work whilst handling changing priorities

title: Assembler/Tester
description:
2nd Shift : 3:00pm - 11:30pm or 3:00pm - 1:30am

Pay Starts at $ 17.51/hr.+ based upon experience along with a shift premium!

Assembler

Springfield, MO

About Us

MD Kinney, a division of Ingersoll Rand, manufactures blowers, vacuum systems, and engineered systems for industrial, commercial, and government applications. Our products are designed by industry leading engineers, and manufactured to exacting specifications. Our knowledgeable team takes metal castings and other raw materials and turns them into the high-performing products we are known for around the world. For more information, visit our website: www.md-kinney.com.

Job Summary

Responsible for accurately assembling a variety of sizes and models of product based on standard work and engineering documents.

Responsibilities

 Create, utilize, and improve Standard Work Combination Sheets to document assembly processes to ensure consistency and repeatability. Participate in the 5 Why process to ensure real time problem solving, drive continuous improvement and prevent problems from reoccurring. Implement visual controls throughout work area to provide ease of cross training and reduce assembly cycle time. Participate in daily Red Dot / Green Dot tracking and provide valuable feedback to progress on the Business Awareness Matrix. Reads and interprets blueprints. Reads, interprets, and follows Bill of Material to pull parts for assembly and submit corrections as needed. Utilizes measurement tools and correctly interpret readings. Assemble units of a variety of sizes and models through use of the standard work and interpretation of Engineering controlled documents. Confer with engineering, supervisory, and manufacturing personnel to exchange technical information.

Basic Qualifications

 High School Diploma 1-2 years’ experience working in a manufacturing environment preferred 1-2 years’ assembly preferred

Work Arrangements/Requirements

 Ability to perform repetitive lifting up to 35 lbs Ability to stand/walk for long periods of time Ability to wear PPE during working hours

Key Competencies

 Ability to read and interpret blueprints. Ability to read and interpret Bill of Materials and Engineering controlled documents. Ability to identify and solve problems.

What We Offer

Competitive pay

Competitive 401k match

Health and wellness benefits effective day 1

Company paid short-term disability

Annual merit increases

Paid vacation, sick, holidays, etc.

Stock option

and more!

Ownership Works Grant: When you have reached your one-year service anniversary with Ingersoll Rand, you will become eligible to receive a grant of restricted stock units (“RSUs”) that will equal 10% of your annual base salary in grant date value. The actual grant will take place either in the quarter of eligibility or the following quarter based on specified grant schedules. The RSUs will vest two years from the date of grant.

title: Account Manager (Springfield/Joplin)
description:
Title: Account Manager - General Line

Location: Springfield, MO

Job Summary

Ingersoll Rand's Compression Systems & Services Division is hiring for a General Line Account Manager to join their team. This role will support our Upper Midwest Area remotely, with responsibility for managing a territory within the Joplin/Springfield, MO area. While traveling within this specific geographic region, you will be responsible for driving the Customer Center equipment sales and service activity. This includes quoting, strategizing, prospecting, and developing relationships to achieve revenue targets, maximize profits, increase market share and maintain customer loyalty while achieving organizational goals.

Responsibilities

Responsible for generating sales of equipment, service contracts, and service offerings with our direct end users and partners selling to a defined customer base within a geographic area. Provide and design compressed air solutions to fulfill industrial customer needs, including compressed air equipment, accessories, turnkey installations, service, parts, service, rental equipment and energy audits. Provide selling skills and product/services training for dealer sales personnel (as required) as well as personnel within customer center. Ensure adherence to safety rules (vehicle safety, customer site safety) in the field, as well as in the customer center. Manage quote log, pipeline and record customer interactions in the data management system (Sales Force). Record follow-up activities (e.g. delivery), reporting (email) and database requirements. Support and manage your orders by working closely with the inside sales and service team. Maintain, develop and grow existing territory through end user prospecting to obtain annual sales targets for the designated territory in both equipment and service sales. 

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, engineering technology, business or equivalent from a four-year college or university preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum of four (4) years’ experience in an industrial sales business setting. Proficient in Microsoft Office software Knowledge of Salesforce preferred. Must possess a valid driver’s license for a minimum of 12 months, with no major or frequent traffic violations included, but not limited to: DUI in the previous 5 years; Hit & Run, License Suspension, Reckless/Careless Driving or multiple smaller infractions or preventable collisions in the previous 3 years. 

Key Competencies

Excellent relationship-building and interpersonal skills, including verbal, written and presentation communication skills. Establishes and builds solid relationships with customers, key institutions and team members Honest, self-motivated and team oriented. Able to work within a team environment and independently. Mechanical and electrical expertise required. Ability to assess customer needs, analyze and interpret, perform basic equipment performance calculations, and to recommend technical solutions Tech savvy; knowledge of Salesforce preferred Proven business and sales acumen, including the ability to prospect accounts, effectively navigate within a customer organization, value sell, and win competitive accounts Must have excellent prioritization and time management skills?

title: Precision Assembler - 2nd Shift
description:
Precision Assembler

2ndshift Mon-Fri 2:00pm to 10:00pm

Pay Starts at $22/hr. and can go up based upon experience!

Precision Assembler - 2nd Shift

Location

Onsite at Mocksville, NC

Responsibilities

Job Summary

 Performs all mechanical assembly operations of sub-assemblies and package assembly, all sensitive and very detailed assembly operations, some electrical, instrumentation and control elements of the package, and functional test set up including in-process quality checks and tests. Performs disassembly and rebuild of air ends, or sensitive rotating assemblies. Reads and interprets engineering drawings, specifications, assembly instructions, bills of material, and quality control documents. Takes responsibility for quality and work content performed in the applicable operation by signing off on the appropriate documentation prior to indexing to the next step in process. Insures that all tools used in performing job duties are within calibration, as stated on calibration sticker. Where discrepancies arise, immediate notification of supervisor occurs. Performs job duties with limited supervision. Maintains clean, orderly, and safe work area and follow all safety rules and procedures. Uses problem solving skills (identify problems and respond correctly). Shall be capable of performing disassembly and rebuild of air ends, or sensitive rotating assemblies Exhibits a high degree of manual dexterity with great attention to detail and workmanship Use of calipers, dial, indicators, precision measuring devices. And other assigned duties

Basic Qualifications

 Strong problem solving skills (identify problems and respond correctly). Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings, specifications, assembly instructions, bills of material and quality control documents. Ability to use correct tooling, fixturing and equipment to perform work tasks to engineering specifications. Ability to function in a flexible team environment.

Travel & Work Arrangements/Requirements

 Fully site based

Key Competencies

 Formal training from technical or trade school is desired by not required. Two years mechanical assembly of mechanical equipment or equivalent technology. Minimum of one year experience with assembly of equipment requiring a high degree of precision. Ability to read blueprints, schematics, and electrical wiring diagrams Perform welding, fabrication, and pipefitting where needed

title: Production Scheduler
description:
Position Responsibilities

Translate the monthly SIOP consensus plan by product family to a detailed weekly production schedule with a 12-18 month planning horizon into the ERP for weekly MRP generation Incorporate inter-company demand and backlog into SIOP supply planning process to ensure capacity and resources are available to meet demand requirements. Monitor and drive resolution of MRP processing errors. Support customer service with exception request analysis and expediting resolution. Create and publish daily/weekly/monthly factory schedule adherence, capacity, and inventory shortages. Identification and resolution of Constraints - Capacity, Resource & Material. Conducts a demonstrated lead-time analysis and measures gap to published lead times. Drives corrective action plan and reviews and updates published lead-times. Data analysis and reporting of key performance indicators such as: delivery performance, backlog, performance to master schedule and inventory turns. Drives continuous process improvement, strives to improve efficiency, likely to challenge processes where favorable alternatives may be available. Timely management of exception messages generated by the ERP system. Maintain data integrity of ERP planning parameters. Parameters such as lead times, lot sizes, safety stocks, delivery times, and order file data for all scheduled items Coordinates with planners to meet assigned goals for serviceability and inventory. Provide training on master production scheduling procedures and processes. 

Key Competencies And Success Factors

Ability to effectively make complex decisions with limited time and information and can determine decision making criteria based on priorities. Ability to collaborate effectively across multiple disciplines with internal and external resources. Strong analytical capabilities, with a basic understanding of statistical analysis techniques. Strong interpersonal skills, independent problem resolution, proven leadership ability, and the ability to manage the requirement of others. Comfortable leading discussion and debate both within peer group and with matrix business partners, operational partners and leaders. Data access/retrieval skills with extensive experience in data analysis, data manipulation using MS Excel and/or other tools as provided. Working knowledge of ERP system- preferably SAP. 

Experience And Skills Required

BS/BA degree in business or engineering discipline preferred Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in analyzing data relating to product forecasting, master scheduling, or shipment forecasting. APICS Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) preferred, not required Experience with rate-based or flow line (non-MRP) and job shop manufacturing environments. Experience in operations, inventory management, MRP and lean manufacturing processes.
